title: WSO2 and Accelalpha Partner to Provide Integration Solutions to Fortune 500 Companies
text:
Accelalpha’ s expertise in business application integration services complements WSO2 open source middleware platform in simplifying and automating business processes to increase productivity
Mountain View, CA (PRWEB) October 14, 2015
WSO2 and Accelalpha today announced a strategic partnership to deliver integration services to clients in North America that will enable organizations to significantly strengthen their competitive advantage.
WSO2 delivers the industry’s most comprehensive open source platform for building, integrating, managing, securing and analyzing companies’ APIs, applications, and Web services—on-premises, in the cloud, on mobile devices, and across the Internet of Things.
Accelalpha combines its expertise in middleware integration, system development, and enterprise application delivery to overcome the integration challenges that companies are facing to achieve scalable and streamlined integration implementations.
Under terms of the agreement, Accelalpha will use WSO2’s open source middleware to provide customers with integration services that are aligned with industry best practices, company business processes, and the supporting business systems. Additionally, WSO2 will provide Accelalpha with technical, sales and marketing support to promote adoption and help customers achieve the high availability, high performance, and flexibility they require for IT and business agility.
“From our experience in implementing business applications, such as enterprise resource planning (ERP), master data management (MDM), and customer relationship management (CRM), we know that these applications do not communicate with one another out-of-the-box or share master data, business rules, and transactions. Trying to solve this with point-to-point or database-level integrations often results in incomplete or non-scalable solutions. This in turn leads to inefficiencies, including identical data stored in multiple locations, lack of process automation, and unnecessary manual efforts,” said Accelalpha Vice President of Consulting Erik Assink. “We passionately believe that WSO2 open source middleware allows for system integrations within or across organizations, and will simplify and automate business processes to the greatest extent possible.”
“Accelalpha brings strong expertise in implementing enterprise application and integration solutions for some of North America’s leading enterprises,” said WSO2 Senior Director of Partnerships Nirosh Perera. “Through our partnership, we are combining Accelalpha’s proven best practices with the flexibility of our comprehensive, modular WSO2 platform to deliver solutions that empower these organizations to maximize their business and IT agility.”
About Accelalpha
Accelalpha provides business and IT consulting services in North America and has an excellent delivery track record with Fortune 100 companies spanning diverse industries. Accelalpha specializes in integration across the enterprise, the supply chain and the cloud, using WSO2’s open source middleware. Visit http://accelalpha.com to learn more, or send an email to pr@accelalpha.com.
About WSO2
WSO2 uniquely delivers on the promise of the connected business. It offers the only completely integrated enterprise platform that enables businesses to build, integrate, manage, secure and analyze their APIs, applications, and Web services—on-premises, in the cloud, on mobile devices, and across the Internet of Things. Leading enterprise customers worldwide rely on WSO2’s award-winning 100% open source platform and its robust performance and governance for their mission-critical applications. Today, these businesses represent nearly every sector: health, financial, retail, logistics, manufacturing, travel, technology, telecom and more. Visit http://wso2.com to learn more, or check out the WSO2 community on the WSO2 Blog, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook.
